channel.title: Show off your setup!
channel.description:
According to the suggestion of @pry0cc, I open this thread in order to give you a place to share your setups and have feedback from the community.
Thanks for your participation.
Here is mine :slight_smile:
https://0x00sec.org/t/hacking-operating-systems-assessment/1323/26?u=nitrax
Best, Nitrax

item.title: Show off your setup!
item.dc:creator: Assossa
item.description:
PCPartPicker Link

I got the CPU, mobo, RAM, case, and PSU from craigslist for just $150. The 2600k is OC’d to 4.4 GHz, a whole +1GHz OC… I have a ssd, but it is currently in my laptop; I am planning on getting a new one soon for my PC.

Here is the rig with the side panel off (it’s a little dusty, sorry):

item.title: Show off your setup!
item.dc:creator: zinzloun
item.description:
Good morning @VVid0w, of course it was a kind of joke, but this is my home setup for real (it’s a good one to play videos for my daughter Actually I miss the time right now to build my own pc. When I was younger and better and I needed more “privacy” I run a different set up of course. I tried LFS as well when I was a student (with very bad result) but it was a great journey. Now for my job I prefer a WinZoZ machine (that I have to say that is understimated ). This is would be a good start poin for an IRC conversation, I’ll try to join the channel soon meanwhile I wish you a good day

Read full topic

item.title: Show off your setup!
item.dc:creator: nopSled
item.description:
Not very set up to show anything off screenshot wise as I am out of the game right now thanks to school but I can post my rig stuff for anyone who possibly gives a hoot.

Intel i7 4790k
Evga Asus z97
32 gb ram
Evga Nvidia gtx980. Intend to buy another and possibly one more of these even if it’s excessive
Don’t even ask about hard drives I have hundreds of them laying around but not all of them are ssd. Which bottlenecks me a little bit. I don’t keep track of the sizes but all together I’m exceeding 5tb.

I pretty much live on this thing. Honestly don’t know what I’d do without it

Read full topic

item.title: Show off your setup!
item.dc:creator: VVid0w
item.description:
Well hey, it’s a great start! Now you just gotta get a good desktop pc, ditch widows botnet, and upgrade to linux hahaha. Personally I would recommend building your own pc, as it’s pretty much just “big boy legos.” If you go out and buy one, then 9 times out of 10, they will up-charge massively for labor.

-Phoenix750

item.title: Show off your setup!
item.dc:creator: zinzloun
item.description:
Good evening (here it’s evening). Even if I’m a new kid here I’d like to share my setup as well

The notebook case is quite damaged (my daughter has walked over it few times) but it works decently yet. I have some stickers on the front cover, above all Vans and Chianti Brew Fighters Club, modestly I’m a member . Avira Free edition installed as well and even a VM player with some VM… But I won’t say which! Of course the desktop background image is a family portrait
Thanks for reading

Like @anon79434934 said he’ve got more clockspeed, RAM (size and clock) and an better airflow (I can agree that my case isn’t the best(but cheap)). I don’t know much about AMD GPU’s so I can’t say much about this topic.

@anon79434934 whats about a little benchmark-contest? Only to show @pry0cc and the others who’s PC faster (I’m truely think yours. ).

item.title: Show off your setup!
item.dc:creator: VVid0w
item.description:
Well, I finally finished ricing my system. Took awhile because of some delays I had.

Operating System:
Kali Linux

Ricing:

  • i3 Window Manager
  • i3blocks for status
  • Termite terminal emulator
  • Atom text editor
  • dmenu for applications

Web Browser:
Firefox-esr with some of twily’s configs

Notes:
Wallpaper isn’t permanent, I’ve yet to make a custom one and I’m not exactly sure when I’m going to get around to doing that lol.

GitHub

13lackWidow/13lackWidowsDotfiles

My dotfiles for sharing and updating new operating systems. - 13lackWidow/13lackWidowsDotfiles

Read full topic
